The #digitaldivide has pushed kids in low-income countries into an educational deficit that could reverberate for years.

🎧 Listen to @AiyarYamini on @imf_podcast to learn more. https://t.co/wYSpe4t6hl https://t.co/7Sp2fDHaeA
Kazakhstan’s economy recovered from the initial effects of the pandemic, with real GDP growth at 4% in 2021. 👉https://t.co/2tn1ia1btO https://t.co/ElX6q4zFNm

The pandemic and the impact of the war in Ukraine will affect Kazakhstan’s growth prospects and fuel inflation in 2022. Greater economic diversification driven by the private sector is needed to support long-term growth.   👉 https://t.co/2tn1ia1btO
How does war affect global finance? Watch our latest Analyze This! video to find out. https://t.co/yaiJHqdsOS https://t.co/kai8jkWbY7

With elevated risks to government debt, countries need a global cooperative approach to resolve debt problems and prevent defaults, the IMF’s Vitor Gaspar and @CeylaP_IMF write in a new #IMFBlog https://t.co/HV6xDBjCo9 https://t.co/tSJqS4bxjy

To ensure sustainable and inclusive economic growth in Kazakhstan, policymakers need to reduce the state’s footprint, improve governance, and act early on climate-related challenges. 👉 https://t.co/2tn1ia1btO https://t.co/HHeFmykKJ7

Our new #FiscalMonitor shows how better international coordination in 3 areas can benefit everyone:
•Taxing large corporations
• Sharing of information on offshore holdings
• Enacting fair carbon pricing

Join us tomorrow, April 12 @ 2:00 PM ET
📺 https://t.co/Ww7C7hU1pp https://t.co/cUC4HNUmIX
#Inflation: what does the future hold? Read our new #FandD series by Ruchir Agarwal and Miles Kimball, here: https://t.co/CT2rbCFyPw https://t.co/bqcDyWS3gB
How much have global food prices increased? Watch our latest #ChartsinMotion video and read #IMFBlog to find out: https://t.co/UqhHKzZXUn https://t.co/4wfr2wF7Mw
Can policymakers target lower, or even zero, inflation in the long term? Read more in #FandD https://t.co/oBclWJKWN4 https://t.co/7aH1XZlVcC

Financial systems are more robust than before the pandemic, continuing a trend that began after the 2008 financial crisis. See our new #IMFBlog for what our novel Global Stress Test shows. https://t.co/GoZtMvwDBx https://t.co/QhdmxrqPgd

The economic shocks from the pandemic and the war in Ukraine are adding to the debt challenges faced by low-income countries. A new #IMFBlog suggests a way forward. https://t.co/o4ZQLp1Fje https://t.co/v1vi7RmIf5
In 2012 the IMF set out an Institutional View on capital flows. Today we are updating our view. Read more in our #IMFBlog. https://t.co/6fIEUp5RXA https://t.co/F84FKo9yXU
Wars affect trade, prices, and the global economy. Watch our Analyze This! video to learn more about the global economic impact of war. https://t.co/yaiJHqdsOS https://t.co/Z3aw7Y2QUv
What is an electronic money standard and can it deliver on a zero #inflation target? Read the third article in #FandD’s trilogy. https://t.co/WWbDsWEQLH https://t.co/FzZAMMHIqJ

Beyond the humanitarian crisis of the war in Ukraine 🇺🇦, all the world’s regions will experience slower growth and faster inflation. Higher food and energy costs will be one of the main channels of the global impact, which we lay out in #IMFBlog https://t.co/LY1urh4vrj https://t.co/ewAp9GJCOX
Wars affect trade, prices, and the global economy. Watch our latest Analyze This video to learn more about the global economic impact of war. https://t.co/yaiJHqv3Gq https://t.co/vAMTUGeJra
Prices of oil and gas have soared since the war in Ukraine. Watch our video to learn about the impact of rising prices and how countries can respond. https://t.co/yaiJHqdsOS https://t.co/iyLwghffMB
An electronic money standard can help policymakers to simultaneously target both full employment and zero inflation. Read more in #FandD: https://t.co/WWbDsWEQLH

What’s behind the recent rise in inflation, what affects how long it stays, and how can governments ensure it does not hang around long term? Read more in a new #FandD article, part of our #inflation series. https://t.co/GQHqeOd4OD https://t.co/UcufxKiiDa

How can countries work together toward a fairer and greener global economy? Our new #FiscalMonitor has some answers. 

Learn more, join the IMF’s Shafik Hebous w/ @OxfamIFIs @SurRuiz and James Roaf w/ @TIME ‘s @JustinWorland 
🗓 April 12 🕘 2:00 PM ET
https://t.co/Ww7C7hU1pp https://t.co/080OWxuSXp
Our Analyze This! video explains why emerging markets are especially vulnerable to the impact of war. https://t.co/VWfqR8qXjy https://t.co/svO2T2hRPO

How does a robust negative interest rate policy help central banks better control inflation and stabilize the economy?

🎧 @imf_podcast talked to @mileskimball and @Ruchir_Agar in the first of a two-part series on #inflation. https://t.co/HW5Igz6R11
Which region will be most impacted by soaring food prices? Watch our latest #ChartsinMotion and read #IMFBlog to find out. https://t.co/UqhHKzZXUn https://t.co/XC2o1hi1Nq
How costly is #inflation? Read the second article in #FandD’s #inflation trilogy https://t.co/oBclWJKWN4 https://t.co/aHHTH0NOgh

Only a small fraction of vaccines used in Africa are actually made in Africa. IMF emergency financing is helping countries free up resources to fund innovation & research. Learn more: https://t.co/W5pT5o6WeO #IMFAfrica https://t.co/e7hgIglyYk

Prices of oil and gas have soared since the war in Ukraine. Watch our Analyze This! video to learn about the impact of rising prices and how countries can respond. https://t.co/yaiJHqdsOS https://t.co/GfXxeIAvIz

The IMF’s Executive Board has established an Administered Account for Ukraine, which is a secure way for donors to give the country bilateral financial assistance. Canada has proposed up to CAD $1 billion to be disbursed through the account. 
Read more: https://t.co/d4gdaIDEnS

Interested in #ClimateChange data? Check the latest update to the IMF’s Climate Change Indicators Dashboard continuously evolving to meet data needs in this existential topic. #IMFData

Go to the dashboard: https://t.co/cffhYD7bmn
More about the updates: https://t.co/HceS0iTXBK https://t.co/0HfYKQSZxV

Yesterday, our new Deputy Managing Director Kenji Okamura spoke at the #ASEAN Finance Ministers & Central Bank Governors meeting on the global & regional economic outlook, and policies to promote economic recovery after COVID. More about his background: https://t.co/fHGvCJTn0S https://t.co/VZePMqJBKp
Will #inflation remain high? Read the first story in our inflation trilogy to find out. #FandD https://t.co/GQHqeOd4OD https://t.co/IHgShhYGgY

The economic shocks from the pandemic and the war in Ukraine are adding to the debt challenges faced by low-income countries. A new #IMFBlog suggests a way forward. https://t.co/o4ZQLp1Fje https://t.co/YtBuVt7kt8
New progressive tax policies and transparency measures will be necessary to face challenges beyond the pandemic, @alexcobham writes for #FandD. https://t.co/r6iFaBO1QZ https://t.co/aGxJxOyyhq
#Inflation: what does the future hold? Read our new #FandD series by Ruchir Agarwal and Miles Kimball, here: https://t.co/CT2rbCFyPw https://t.co/f5auASXF8z

Financial systems are more robust than before the pandemic, continuing a trend that began after the 2008 financial crisis. See our new #IMFBlog for what our novel Global Stress Test shows. https://t.co/GoZtMvwDBx https://t.co/WdByjTEk71

Health security is economic security. Our new staff working paper calls for about $15 billion in grants in 2022 and $10 billion annually to fight pandemics and strengthen health systems. https://t.co/8itxTk3OR7  #WorldHealthDay https://t.co/7X17ci4WNM

📰 Read our full press release:
https://t.co/U37HnNkbfR

🇱🇧 Lebanon and the IMF have reached a staff-level agreement on a set of comprehensive economic reforms, with several the authorities will implement prior to the IMF Board meeting. Broad political support for this program and financing from donors are key for its success. https://t.co/BzjeYinZUB

The debt of poorer countries has crept up for the past decade and changes to creditor composition makes restructuring debt more complex. A new #IMFBlog explains why. https://t.co/o4ZQLp1Fje https://t.co/B32vmrLIJo

While Japan has one of the highest numbers of industrial robots in the world, it continues to lag in digital adoption by businesses, government, and the financial sector. Read more about the Japanese economy in our latest economic assessment: https://t.co/MDMswfDtsb https://t.co/cwlSHgq7zl

In 2012 the IMF set out an Institutional View on capital flows. Today we are updating our view. Read more in our #IMFBlog.
https://t.co/6fIEUp5RXA https://t.co/JEEHL6J5vT

The Japanese economy is recovering from the pandemic amid strong policy support that has helped mitigate the downturn. Read our latest annual economic assessment here: https://t.co/MDMswfDtsb https://t.co/Amosn5FlLO

Our new Global Stress Test shows financial systems are now more robust than before the pandemic, but some emerging markets could come under pressure. See #IMFBlog for more: https://t.co/GoZtMvwDBx https://t.co/7FICPF3Rmf

This year’s @BIS_org-@BankOfEngland-@ECB-IMF Spillover Conference (April 27-28) will focus on the international transmission of vulnerabilities, shocks and policies, and the trade-offs for policymakers. Register to participate here: https://t.co/Cexjx236dH https://t.co/olLQw3bXsd

Financial systems are now more robust than before the 2008 financial crisis and even continued strengthening during the pandemic, according to a first-of-its-kind IMF assessment of potential shocks and spillovers. #IMFBlog https://t.co/GoZtMvwDBx https://t.co/yBKzVtH8H2

STARTING NOW a discussion on how to shore up debt sustainability w/ @CeylaP_IMF, @SAISHopkins @BrettonWoodsCom’s John Lipsky, @Harvard's @krogoff, & @AFRODAD2011’s @JasonBraganza1

🗓 April 6 🕘 8:30 AM ET
📺 https://t.co/Zchd5y4mAW https://t.co/931u8LHKV2

Join us TODAY for discussion on debt risks and ways to shore up sustainability w/ @CeylaP_IMF, @SAISHopkins @BrettonWoodsCom’s John Lipsky, @Harvard's @krogoff, & @AFRODAD2011’s @JasonBraganza1

🗓 April 6 🕘 8:30 AM ET
📺 https://t.co/1i4HjqQYQD https://t.co/dnUO5CpOlW

Our new climate Public Investment Management Assessment tool helps countries identify potential improvements in how they manage climate investments. Learn more: https://t.co/ZnfwrYziGY https://t.co/0WUuROrRrV

Today, Deputy Managing Director Bo Li spoke on central bank digital currencies (#CBDCs) and #cryptoassets at AFRITAC East. Read his remarks here to learn more: https://t.co/bM0HiCp5Fp #fintech https://t.co/pmRqIOfaVL

Health security is economic security. Our new staff working paper calls for about $15 billion in grants in 2022 and $10 billion annually to fight pandemics and strengthen health systems. https://t.co/8itxTk3OR7 https://t.co/16D788Uuc5

How much have global food prices increased? 

Watch our latest Charts in Motion video and follow @IMFnews to stay up to date on discussions of global concern.

Our latest Analyze This! video explains why emerging markets are especially vulnerable to the impact of war. 

Follow us for more videos and latest news on economic topics of global interest. https://t.co/d6WpGUuoGN

What exactly does the IMF do? 

Check out these 5 fast facts and follow us to stay up to date on our work.

How will central banks issue and circulate digital currencies? Our new fintech analysis looks at 3 models.

For the latest news on economic topics of global interest follow us.

The costs from the pandemic continue to grow with insufficient progress toward global targets. Our new staff working paper proposes a comprehensive toolkit to fight COVID-19 and strengthen health systems. https://t.co/8itxTk3OR7

Join us TOMORROW for a discussion on debt risks, restructuring, and development @CeylaP_IMF, @SAISHopkins @BrettonWoodsCom’s John Lipsky, @Harvard's @krogoff, & @AFRODAD2011’s @JasonBraganza1

🗓 April 6 🕘 8:30 AM ET
📺 https://t.co/Zchd5y4mAW https://t.co/onQJZ58avz

In some circumstances, pre-emptive measures can help countries manage the risks from capital inflows, as we explain in a new #IMFblog.
https://t.co/6fIEUp5RXA https://t.co/cb6XP1BP7b

IMF/World Bank Spring Meetings bring discussions of global concern – including inflation, the pandemic, and war– to your fingertips. How?

☑️Follow Us
☑️Watch the live stream events
☑️Join the conversation via #IMFmeetings

IMF/World Bank Spring Meetings bring discussions of global concern – including inflation, the pandemic, and war– to your fingertips. How?

☑️Follow Us
☑️Watch the live stream events
☑️Join the conversation via #IMFmeetings

As the world continues to grapple with inflation, the pandemic, war, and climate change, the 2022 IMF/World Bank Spring Meetings are the perfect platform to discuss these issues and more. 

Follow us to stay up to date and join the conversation via #IMFmeetings.

As the world continues to grapple with inflation, the pandemic, war, and climate change, the 2022 IMF/World Bank Spring Meetings are the perfect platform to discuss these issues and more. 

Follow us to stay up to date and join the conversation via #IMFmeetings.

How can the international community come together to improve debt restructurings?

Join the discussion w/ @CeylaP_IMF, @SAISHopkins @BrettonWoodsCom’s John Lipsky, @Harvard's @krogoff, & @AFRODAD2011’s @JasonBraganza1

🗓 April 6 🕘 8:30 AM ET
📺 https://t.co/1i4HjqQYQD https://t.co/PyJnltJOqD
New progressive tax policies and transparency measures will be necessary to face challenges beyond the pandemic, @alexcobham writes for #FandD. https://t.co/r6iFaBO1QZ https://t.co/uBaaKACeN1

The inflationary impact of higher shipping costs is poised to keep building through the end of this year, adding to faster price increases for many countries. See #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/AT2mM7WGGS https://t.co/2blK3Y4FUL

Credit- and debit-card data from dozens of countries show that the share of online spending in many advanced economies is now at or below trend levels before the pandemic. Read our #IMFBlog with @Mastercard @HarvardHBS https://t.co/QWT5TxtABP https://t.co/ORQLiMZOBp

Higher prices for commodities like food and energy will be one of the main channels for how the war in Ukraine will further affect the global economy. #IMFBlog details how every region will feel the effects. https://t.co/LY1urh4vrj https://t.co/2fcR72hvy2

Capital flows bring substantial benefits but can also pose risks to macroeconomic and financial stability. Read our #IMFBlog on how countries can manage these flows. https://t.co/FAOlRkL0c8 https://t.co/zgyJTs4Svp

The IMF has released a new database on the cross-border flows and positions of Special Purpose Entities for 26 economies. Using the database our Chart of the Week provides a more granular view of foreign direct investment in each economy. #IMFBlog https://t.co/RpaYxg6A1x https://t.co/sBxEz9RXzQ

Developing countries must raise significant revenue in the fairest way possible to achieve a durable economic recovery. Read how the personal income tax can help in our new #IMFBlog https://t.co/yG7mFoSm37 https://t.co/ZrA40jNvpF
Our latest Analyze This! video explains why emerging markets are especially vulnerable to the impact of war. https://t.co/VWfqR8qXjy https://t.co/J8tR4pWYkm

Employment is recovering in some advanced economies, but insufficient applicants remain a problem, increasing pressure on wages. New IMF staff research explores the impact on inequality, wages, and public policies. https://t.co/7a9wOqavVX https://t.co/QLYwTQWt0x
Which region will be most impacted by soaring food prices? Watch our latest #ChartsinMotion and read #IMFBlog to find out. https://t.co/UqhHKzZXUn https://t.co/54dKvKIglg

Could short-term training programs, labor laws and regulations that facilitate telework, and a resumption of immigration help address the current labor shortage? Read the latest IMF staff research. https://t.co/7a9wOqavVX https://t.co/FcR78NRHGm

The fight against #climatechange requires massive investments. But poor oversight of public investments can cause countries to waste 1/3 of their resources. The IMF has developed a new tool to help countries manage climate investments better. Learn more: https://t.co/ZnfwrYziGY https://t.co/B80vxKkcdb
Why are the economies of the Caucasus and Central Asia particularly vulnerable to shocks? Read our #IMFBlog to find out. https://t.co/7U2GBFtyCz https://t.co/pUuReGeCto
How much have global food prices increased? Watch our latest #ChartsinMotion video and read #IMFBlog to find out: https://t.co/UqhHKzZXUn https://t.co/aJXAPALrmX

As the world grapples with inflation, the pandemic, war, and climate change, the World Bank – IMF 2022 Spring Meetings are the perfect platform to discuss these issues, and more. 
➡️Check out our lineup and follow via #IMFmeetings. 
https://t.co/3walrDlnJw https://t.co/gJWbsjDmOk

Why aren’t job vacancies in advanced economies being filled? COVID-19 may have changed workers’ job preferences. Read our latest #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/cGO7ypOJDU #IMFBlog https://t.co/uUhiWDWzqA
Why have unfilled job vacancies increased in the US and UK? Our latest Analyze This video explains the reasons behind the ‘Great Resignation.’ https://t.co/mKXc7VUHiF

⛈ Extreme weather
💧 Water scarcity
🌊 Rising sea levels

Climate change is transforming 🇪🇬 Egypt, particularly its soil. But #Egypt is adapting through soilless agriculture. https://t.co/X9QUWyfCVm

In the United States and United Kingdom, the annual growth rate of nominal wages in low-pay industries increased by 4 to 6 percentage points between mid-2020 and late 2021 because of the tight jobs market. Read more about the impact on inflation. https://t.co/cGO7ypx8Mm #IMFBlog

How can we combat #climatechange more effectively? Improving how countries manage their public investments is one way. Find out how our new tool can help: https://t.co/ZnfwrYhHPq https://t.co/Q7p8DtRapA

COVID-19 may have changed worker preferences, most clearly away from some low-pay jobs. Voluntary quits have risen most in industries with larger shares of contact-intensive, physically strenuous, or less flexible jobs. More in this staff research: https://t.co/7a9wOqs7kx https://t.co/pUNBrPlL99

Want to work at the IMF? In a townhall with students @GUQatar, Managing Director @KGeorgieva told students what we look for. 

Join us ➡️ https://t.co/gCVYY1Jif4 https://t.co/peENx5Hork

Tight labor markets have pushed up wage growth across the board. But the impact on low-wage sectors in the United States and United Kingdom has been twice as large. https://t.co/cGO7ypOJDU #IMFBlog https://t.co/XyoYErOIRT

Labor shortages have pushed up wages and added to inflation risks. Bringing more workers back into the labor force would ease the inflationary pressures. Check out the new IMF staff research. https://t.co/7a9wOqs7kx https://t.co/BwUl9EuzII

Debt risks are on the rise. The war in Ukraine will aggravate debt issues of several EMs and LICs. 

Join us w/ @CeylaP_IMF, @SAISHopkins @BrettonWoodsCom’s John Lipsky, @Harvard's @krogoff, & @AFRODAD2011’s @JasonBraganza1 

🗓 April 6 🕘 8:30 AM ET
📺https://t.co/ZmxKWAKp1Y https://t.co/aXBtP2nyj0

Why aren’t job vacancies in advanced economies being filled? COVID-19 may have changed workers’ job preferences. Read our latest #IMFBlog for more. https://t.co/8ZBeqXwN16 #IMFBlog https://t.co/cp5AV7YkCw

By 2050, average summertime temperatures could exceed 30 degrees Celsius in half the countries of the Middle East and Central Asia. A new #IMFBlog calls for climate adaptation. https://t.co/knsQKqiQkS https://t.co/144JL5h0vY

Capital flows bring substantial benefits but can also pose risks to macroeconomic and financial stability. Read our #IMFblog on how countries can manage these flows.
https://t.co/FAOlRkL0c8 https://t.co/bGqaemCfWZ

Don’t expect the IMF to abandon the focus on sound economies, says @KGeorgieva. But expect the IMF to give more attention to painting a comprehensive picture of what it means to have a good economy. https://t.co/PQ9UjnaCmu

While speaking with students @GUQatar, IMF Chief @KGeorgieva reflected on her lived experience growing up in an emerging market and how that shaped her understanding of the IMF’s work. @QF https://t.co/IQ21kCEOf2

Countries should have more flexibility to introduce measures to manage capital flows. Read our #IMFBlog to learn about the changes to our Institutional View.
https://t.co/FAOlRkL0c8 https://t.co/ufYKqu5Edb
How has the pandemic affected students? Check out our #ChartsinMotion video and read more on #IMFBlog https://t.co/itjfp7Rcv3 https://t.co/UlCLrQ5tdr

Climate change kills more people in countries with low resilience, including Afghanistan 🇦🇫, Somalia 🇸🇴, Sudan 🇸🇩, and Pakistan 🇵🇰. A new #IMFblog explains how to adapt and build resilience. https://t.co/knsQKqiQkS https://t.co/E4zwsY1l1b

In the Middle East and Central Asia, the poorest conflict-affected countries are suffering the most from climate change. A new #IMFblog underscores the need for adaptation. https://t.co/knsQKqiQkS https://t.co/ExlC4dihe4

What is the IMF’s top priority in dealing with the economic impact of the war in Ukraine in the weeks and months ahead? Identify countries at risk and be ready to assist them. @WorldGovSummit https://t.co/i5zAiYL82H

In March 2020, the IMF predicted a global economic depression. That didn’t happen. Managing Director @KGeorgieva commended the decisive and coordinated action taken by finance authorities and central banks worldwide. #WorldGovSummit https://t.co/IRxqeO7Lb4

When a situation evolves, our knowledge evolves with it. In conversation with CNN’s @richardquest, @KGeorgeiva addressed how the IMF rolls with changes in the world economy by updating our advice to countries. @WorldGovSummit https://t.co/7krVJxGODt

IMF Chief @KGeorgieva explains the economic impact of war in Ukraine, Russia, and beyond @WorldGovSummit in #Dubai. 
@questCNN @richardquest https://t.co/YtIwwwiHos
